statements: SELECT * FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_depth > 100
SELECT drill_location, drill_temperature FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_temperature BETWEEN 150 AND 200
SELECT seismic_survey_id, seismic_survey_results FROM geothermal_exploration_data ORDER BY seismic_survey_date DESC
SELECT * FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_location LIKE 'Site%'
SELECT DISTINCT drill_location FROM geothermal_exploration_data
SELECT * FROM geothermal_exploration_data ORDER BY drill_depth DESC, drill_temperature ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT drill_id, drill_location FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_temperature > 200 ORDER BY drill_id ASC
SELECT AVG(drill_depth) AS average_depth, MAX(drill_temperature) AS max_temperature FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_location = 'California'
SELECT * FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE seismic_survey_id IN (1, 2, 3) AND seismic_survey_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30'
SELECT drill_id, drill_temperature, seismic_survey_results FROM geothermal_exploration_data WHERE drill_location LIKE '%geyser%' ORDER BY drill_id DESC
SELECT * FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 100 ORDER BY depth ASC;
SELECT well_name, pressure FROM drilling_results WHERE depth < 500 ORDER BY well_name DESC;
SELECT survey_name, survey_date FROM seismic_surveys WHERE depth_covered > 1000 ORDER BY survey_date ASC;
SELECT location FROM seismic_surveys WHERE survey_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY location DESC;
SELECT id, well_name, depth FROM drilling_results WHERE pressure < 500 ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results WHERE depth > 500 AND temperature < 100 ORDER BY pressure DESC;
SELECT id, well_name FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature >= 80 AND pressure < 1000;
SELECT survey_name, location, survey_date FROM seismic_surveys WHERE depth_covered > 1000 ORDER BY survey_date ASC;
SELECT id, well_name, depth, temperature, pressure FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 70 AND pressure BETWEEN 500 AND 1000;
SELECT * FROM seismic_surveys WHERE location LIKE '%California%' OR location LIKE '%Texas%' ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results;
SELECT id, depth FROM drilling_results ORDER BY depth DESC;
SELECT * FROM seismic_surveys WHERE location='North Sea';
SELECT id, depth, data->>'owner' AS owner FROM seismic_surveys WHERE depth > 1000;
SELECT e.id, d.depth, s.location FROM exploration_data AS e JOIN drilling_results AS d ON e.result_id = d.id JOIN seismic_surveys AS s ON e.survey_id = s.id;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results ORDER BY depth DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, temperature FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 50;
SELECT location, depth FROM seismic_surveys WHERE location LIKE 'North%' OR location LIKE 'South%';
SELECT well_id, survey_id, result_id FROM exploration_data WHERE survey_id = 3;
SELECT id, depth, temperature FROM drilling_results WHERE depth BETWEEN 100 AND 500;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results;
SELECT id, depth, temperature FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 50;
SELECT * FROM seismic_surveys ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT location, survey_date FROM seismic_surveys WHERE survey_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT line_id, location FROM fault_lines WHERE depth < 100 ORDER BY length DESC;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results ORDER BY depth DESC, temperature ASC;
SELECT well_id, depth FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 50 ORDER BY depth ASC;
SELECT location, survey_date FROM seismic_surveys WHERE survey_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM well_locations WHERE latitude > 40 AND longitude < -100 ORDER BY depth DESC;

SELECT fault_lines.location, fault_lines.length, well_locations.latitude FROM fault_lines JOIN well_locations ON fault_lines.depth > well_locations.depth ORDER BY fault_lines.length DESC, well_locations.latitude ASC;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results;
SELECT depth, temperature FROM drilling_results WHERE temperature > 50;
SELECT id, location FROM seismic_surveys ORDER BY location ASC;
SELECT * FROM well_locations WHERE latitude < 30 AND longitude > 100;
SELECT team_name, supervisor FROM exploration_teams;
SELECT * FROM drilling_results ORDER BY depth DESC, temperature ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT well_id, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM drilling_results GROUP BY well_id HAVING AVG(temperature) > 50;
SELECT DISTINCT location FROM seismic_surveys WHERE depth > 1000;
SELECT team_name, COUNT(well_id) AS num_wells FROM well_locations JOIN exploration_teams ON well_locations.well_id = exploration_teams.team_id GROUP BY team_name ORDER BY num_wells DESC;
SELECT * FROM exploration_logs WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31' ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5;
